avalancheActivity.highlights: With the onset of the intense snowfall, the avalanche activity will rapidly increase. Numerous avalanches are to be expected, even large ones.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Rapid increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind.
The new snow can be released easily or naturally in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line. Avalanches can in some cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach large size.
In the typical avalanche paths in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanches can reach fairly large size and in some places endanger transportation routes that are exposed.

Single backcountry tourers can release avalanches easily, caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase from the early morning.
The current avalanche situation calls for great caution and restraint. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack and natural avalanches are a clear indication of a weakly bonded snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 60 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall in the next few hours above approximately 1200 m.
The new snow and wind slabs will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on shady slopes above approximately 1400 m.

Shady slopes: The snowpack is fairly homogeneous; its surface is loosely bonded and consists of surface hoar and faceted crystals.
Steep sunny slopes: The snowpack is well consolidated and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday: The large quantity of fresh snow as well as the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. Remotely triggered and natural avalanches are probable.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: From late morning the avalanche activity will gradually increase.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow can be released easily, or, in isolated cases, naturally in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line.
As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase from the late morning. They are to be found in particular in steep terrain above approximately 1400 m and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
The avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size.
Additionally to some extent avalanches can also be triggered in the old snowpack and reach large size in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 4 (high).

Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack and natural avalanches are a clear indication of a weakly bonded snowpack.
The current avalanche situation calls for caution and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall on Tuesday above approximately 1300 m. The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

Shady slopes: The old snowpack is faceted and weak; its surface is loosely bonded and consists of surface hoar and faceted crystals.

Steep sunny slopes: The snowpack is well consolidated and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday: The fresh snow as well as the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Remotely triggered and natural avalanches are possible.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: The avalanche danger will already increase in the late morning.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow and wind slabs of Tuesday will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. This applies especially along the border with France.

Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Below approximately 2200 m and in the Prealps the avalanche prone locations are more rare and the danger is lower.

Be careful of the numerous rocks hidden by the little snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunny slopes and below the tree line: The snowpack is fairly homogeneous and its surface has a melt-freeze crust.
Shady slopes and in places that are protected from the wind: The old snowpack is faceted and weak; its surface is loosely bonded and consists of surface hoar and faceted crystals. Large-grained weak layers exist in the bottom section of the snowpack here.

At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At high altitudes and in high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

15 to 30 cm of snow will fall on Tuesday above approximately 1300 m, especially in the Prealps.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on northwest, north and east facing slopes.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: The avalanche danger will already increase in the late morning.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow and wind slabs of Tuesday will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released even by a single winter sport participant.

Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
At high altitudes and in high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.

Shady slopes: The old snowpack is faceted and weak; its surface is loosely bonded and consists of surface hoar and faceted crystals.
20 to 40 cm of snow will fall on Tuesday above approximately 1300 m, especially in the Prealps.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming during the snowfall will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on northwest, north and east facing slopes.
The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack. Remotely triggered and natural avalanches are possible in isolated cases.
